did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: John Myhill Collection of Manuscript Scores and Papers, circa 1967-1984

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains scores of five compositions by John Myhill in varied states of completion and a folder of sketches and musical analyses. The collection also contains a folder of prose writings and a single piece of correspondence to Myhill.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], John Myhill Collection of Manuscript Scores and Papers, circa 1967-1984, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Myhill was born 11 August 1923 in Birmingham, England. He earned a B.A. in 1944 at Cambridge University and a Ph.D. at Harvard University in 1949. He served as a professor of mathematics at the University at Buffalo 1966-1987 and had previously taught at other institutions, including Vassar, Yale University, Temple University, University of California at Berkeley, Stanford University, and University of Illinois. Prof. Myhill also had an avid interest in music theory and composition throughout his life. He died 15 February 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains scores of five compositions by John Myhill in varied states of completion and a folder of sketches and musical analyses. The collection also contains a folder of prose writings and a single piece of correspondence to Myhill.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is chiefly arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle:
Authentic genuine Rumanian vampyre trap,
undated

scopecontent.p: Instrumentation not specified but includes cello and piano.
"For David Rosenboom, whether he likes it or not"--Caption.
Appears to be incomplete and includes sketches.

physdesc.extent: 1 holograph score (17 pages) and typescript performance instructions (7 pages)

scopecontent.p: The work was also titled Astarte on other copies.

did.unittitle: Fourteen songs about money. Songs 1-3, undated

scopecontent.p: Includes a transposed version and full photocopy.
I need your capital -- I had a little money -- I went the other side of India.

did.unittitle: Harmonic scheme of Fourteen songs about money, undated

scopecontent.p: I need your capital -- I had a little money -- I went the other side of India -- Fifteen months after I was at Bombay.

did.unittitle: Manuscript music sketches and analyses, undated

scopecontent.p: Postcard from soprano Isabelle Ganz to Myhill, May 10, 1984.

The prose notes concern text stresses, including phrases from The Odyssey in translations by Alexander Pope and George Chapman. Other keywords include "measured computation rules" and "ordinal recursion".
